data.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger: ‘Heart surgery really makes you think’
data.meta_description: He went from Mr Universe to Hollywood action star to governor of California; now at 76 Arnold Schwarzenegger is becoming a self-help guru with a new book — sample wisdom, ‘Rest is for babies’
data.text:
Arnold Schwarzenegger is 45 minutes late — but what are you going to do, tick off the Terminator for his timekeeping? — and, when he does eventually materialise, blithely unencumbered by apologies. “What an outfit you’ve got on there,” he says, chuckling. “It matches my umbrella.”

The giant umbrella under which Schwarzenegger is sitting — in a large leather armchair beside the outdoor fireplace at his mansion in Brentwood, Los Angeles — is a garish shade of yellow; my dress — which I am sporting in my flat in Brighton — a nuclear neon orange. Maybe I look a little like a traffic cone, but nothing like Schwarzenegger’s umbrella. I like to think it’s his idiosyncratic way of establishing intimacy.

“Where’s the lens here?” he
